itemDescription: Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross

wikipedia_page.main: James Park VC (1835 – 14 June 1858) was a Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

link_mentions.page: List of Scottish Victoria Cross recipients

response: *James Park – recipient of the Victoria Cross
*James Park (VC) (1835–1858), recipient of the Victoria Cross
*James Park (geologist) (1857–1946), New Zealand geologist, director of school of mines, university professor and writer
*James Park (entrepreneur), American tech entrepreneur, co-founder and CEO of Fitbit

**Sergeant Bernard Diamond, Gunner Richard Fitzgerald, Lieutenant Hastings Edward Harrington, Lieutenant James Hills-Johnes, Rough Rider Edward Jennings, Gunner Thomas Laughnan, Gunner Hugh McInnes, Captain William Olpherts, Gunner James Park, Captain George Alexander Renny, Lieutenant Frederick Roberts, Bombardier Jacob Thomas, Lieutenant Colonel Henry Tombs, Major Richard Keatinge.
* James Park, soldier, recipient of the Victoria Cross (killed in action 1858 in India)
